Identification_Area.title: Target Mode F of Alpha Table (Updated Version)

Citation_Information.description: "This table provides updated F-of-Alpha photometric correction factors for target-mode reflectance data. The factors are dependent on phase angle (alpha) and channel (wavelength) and were derived from highland data. While using version 1.0 of the Level 2 M3 archive delivered to PDS, the data between 2500 and 3000 nanometers were found to have unexpected behavior, including a reduction in the absolute value and two spurious features that could be confused with absorptions. These residual spectral features were also seen in the phase function. Since the phase function was derived from version 3.0 of the archived Level 1 data, these residuals are also present in those data. Including these residuals in the photometric correction amplifies them in the archived V1.0 Level 2 data. To reduce the residuals, a linear extrapolation of the phase function from 1500 to 2500 nanometers was applied to the phase function to 3000 nanometers. Thus, this new phase function only affects data from 2500 to 3000 nanometers. To apply this table, the V1.0 Level 2 photometry factors should be removed (that is, divided out) as described in the M3 Data Product SIS [/document/DPSIS.PDF] then this updated table should be applied. This analysis is discussed in the paper 'A Visible and Near-Infrared Photometric Correction for the Moon Mineralogy Mapper (M3)' by Besse, et al., (2012) [BESSEETAL2012]." (Original description) This table is some sense not really "observational" data and the timestamp below is simply the product creation time.

External_Reference.reference_text: Besse, S. et al. (2013). A visible and near-infrared photometric correction for Moon Mineralogy Mapper (M3). Icarus, 222(1), 229-242.

Header.name: Header
Header.description: This header counts the 256 target-mode channels (1 to 256) of F-of-Alpha photometric correction factors in this table.

Table_Character.description: This table provides updated F-of-Alpha photometric correction factors for target-mode reflectance data.

Field_Character.name: Phase Angle
Field_Character.description: This column contains integral phase angles from 0 to 98 degrees.

Group_Field_Character.name: F of Alpha Correction Factors
Group_Field_Character.description: "This column contains derived F-of-Alpha photometric correction factors, one for each of the 256 channels (bands) of target-mode data. Each value is a unitless multiplicative factor used for the F-of-Alpha photometric correction." (original description) In the original PDS3 label, this is described as a single 'column' containing 256 'items', a conceptual classification that we believe maps best to the PDS4 group/field hierarchy.

Field_Character.name: F of Alpha Factor
Field_Character.description: F of alpha correction factor for an individual channel.
